frame.name: Sidereal_appearance
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> comes into view above the horizon as part of a regular, periodic process of (apparent) motion of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> across the sky. In the case of the sun, the appearance begins the day.
<ex><fex name="ast">Venus</fex> <t>rose</t> <fex name="tim">at 5:23 AM</fex>, twenty minutes before the sun which reached the horizon at 5:43 AM.</ex>
<ex>At the time of the new moon, <fex name="ast">the moon</fex> <t>rises</t> <fex name="tim">at about the same time the sun rises</fex>, and it sets at about the same time the sun sets.</ex>
<ex>And, as <fex name="ast">the sun</fex> <t>came</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="goa">over the trees</fex>, it became golden, and then turned again into a silvery path; and the water came alive</ex>
<ex>Each day <fex name="ast">the sun's</fex> <t>rise</t> offers us a new day.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the the state of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> during the motion.
<ex>That morning the sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="dep">blood red</fex> in the east.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location above the horizon that the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> ends up in. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the motion of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> takes place. It covers any description of the appearance which is not covered by more specific FEs such as <fen>Speed</fen>, including general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>), and aesthetic judgements of the event .
<ex>The sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="man">beautifully</fex>, but the air was cold.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sequence of locations that the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> traverses as it comes over the horizon.
<ex>A pale copper sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="pat">through a sea of muted cloud layers</fex>, and now there is no afterglow at all.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Speed</fen> at which the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> comes into view.
<ex>In the summer, the sun <t>comes up</t> <fex name="spe">quickly</fex>, and you?ll need to work fast. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> appears.
<ex>As the sun <t>came</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="tim">at 5:15 am</fex>, it made the red rocks almost glow.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Astronomical_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity which is periodically visible from the earth's surface.
<ex>Heku left one morning as <fex name="ast">the sun</fex> <t>rose</t> along the plain.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> is construed to occupy before coming above the horizon.
<ex>The night passed away, and the sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="Src">from the ocean</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen>'s motion.
<ex> As we continued moving east, the sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="Result">high</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> from which the motion of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> is viewed.
<ex>The very end of the eclipse will be visible as the sun <t>rises</t> <fex name="pla">in some locations in Africa and northeastern North America</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> comes into view above the horizon.
<ex>When the sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="deg">fully</fex>, painting the area a beautiful red gold his father would turn to him and smile.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root> A setting, often temporal or spatial, within which the appearance of the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> takes place
<ex>The Sun <t>rose</t> <fex name="cir">with just a few clouds along the eastern horizon</fex> as we eagerly unpacked our gear.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Correlated_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event that takes place simultaneously with the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen>'s appearance.
<ex>The moon <t>rose</t> <fex name="cor">with the early onset of dusk</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>FN: The amount of times the <fen>Astronomical_entity</fen> appears per unit of time.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: rise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of the sun, moon, or stars) appear above the horizon.

lexUnit.name: come up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (for the sun, moon, or stars) to appear above the horizon

lexUnit.name: rise.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the ascent of an astronomical entity above the horizon
